It takes some nerve to tell veterans – men and women who have sacrificed for our country -- that it’s too much work to audit erroneous payments. The VA is telling vets it’s inconvenient to do their job, leaving vets to figure out a mess they didn’t create. I am appalled.

When the VA told us that computer errors had led to incorrect GI Bill payments, they promised veterans AND Congress that they would ensure full payments were received. Now they are saying, even AFTER the problem is fixed, they won’t make reimbursements... https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/veterans-affairs-dept-tells-congressional-staffers-it-won-t-repay-n941491?cid=sm_npd_ms_tw_ma …

Examples of corporate greed like we’ve seen this week will continue to occur until we restore economic fairness -- including a tax system that emphasizes workers and real job creation over Wall Street excess.
Make no mistake, the President’s efforts to foment fear of immigrants is a classic tactic to deflect criticism for the failed economic policies of the Republican party.

These cuts will devastate the communities built around these plants. Many people in these communities voted for Trump, who lied to them about protecting their jobs. Trump’s response? Blame China, blame Obama, blame immigrants.

GM saved $500 million from the Trump tax scam. Instead of expanding, they used $100 million of that on stock buybacks to pad the pockets of wealthy shareholders. Monday they announced that they will close 5 plants and lay off 15,000 workers to further expand their profit margins.

Every day since that tax cut passed we have gotten more and more frustrating news about shareholders hoarding their windfall while corporate executives stick it to working people. Yesterday’s news from General Motors is just the latest example.

President Trump and the Republican-led Congress rammed through a  $1.5 trillion tax cut this year that they promised would bringing manufacturing jobs back to the United States. In fact, saving US manufacturing was a pillar of Trump’s 2016 campaign. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/gm-layoffs-and-plant-shutdowns-suggest-us-economy-may-be-starting-to-slow--and-dent-trumps-claim-of-an-industrial-renaissance/2018/11/26/39533566-f1ba-11e8-80d0-f7e1948d55f4_story.html?utm_term=.e9328eb0cfd9 …
The incoming New Jersey Delegation may be the best we've ever had; an incredible mix of energy and experience.  I look forward to working with each of you in the new Congress.
I worked with Jeff Van Drew in the NJ Legislature. He is a tireless legislator. I'm confident he will bring his attitude of hard work to job creation and protecting our beautiful coastlines.

I can’t wait for Mikie Sherrill to join the 116th Congress.  A former Navy Pilot and federal prosecutor, Mikie is a no-nonsense voice for working people and veterans. She will bring enormous energy to the 11th District.

As everyone saw during the campaign Andy Kim is a true fighter who doesn’t back down when it comes to representing people in his district. He also brings a wealth of experience from his time in the Obama Admin. The people of New Jersey’s 3rd District are lucky to have him.

Tom Malinowski will be an excellent member of the House. He is a true leader who stood up to dictators during his time in the State Department and will stand up for the people of his district as a their new Congressman.
